intro: Fumaria densiflora subsp. bracteosa, commonly known as the bracteate whitlow grass, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Papaveraceae family, characterized by its delicate, yellowish flowers and hairy stems. The subspecies is distinguished by its distinctive bracts that enclose the flowers, giving it a unique appearance. It typically grows in disturbed soils and open habitats, such as roadsides and fields. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that release tiny seeds, aiding in its dissemination.
